headline: Why Hershey Stock Soared Today
summary: In 2016, Mondelez International failed in its attempt to buy Hershey (NYSE: HSY).  Now more than eight years later, Mondelez is reportedly trying again.  According to Bloomberg, Mondelez just approached Hershey in hopes of acquiring it.

raw.headline: Why Hershey Stock Soared Today
raw.summary: In 2016, Mondelez International failed in its attempt to buy Hershey (NYSE: HSY).  Now more than eight years later, Mondelez is reportedly trying again.  According to Bloomberg, Mondelez just approached Hershey in hopes of acquiring it.

headline: Hershey’s stock explodes higher on report Mondelez offered to buy it
summary: Mondelez, the maker of Oreo and Cadbury, is reportedly exploring an offer to buy rival Hershey Company to potentially create one of the world’s largest candy companies.

headline: Hershey shares jump amid talk of renewed Mondelez interest
summary: Eight years ago, Hershey rejected a $23bn takeover bid from Mondelez – but a report suggests the Cadbury maker is weighing up another move.

headline: Why Is Hershey (HSY) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of chocolate company Hershey (NYSE:HSY) jumped 16.4% in the morning session after Bloomberg reported that Mondelez, the company behind Oreo cookies, is exploring a potential buyout of Hershey. Sources say the discussions are still in the early stages, and Mondelez may not make an offer.

Sources say the discussions are still in the early stages, and Mondelez may not make an offer.

headline: AMD, Alibaba, Mondelez and Hershey: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance host Rachelle Akuffo reports on three of the top market stories and moving stocks in this morning's Market Minute. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock dips following a downgrade to Neutral by Bank of America analysts. Alibaba (BABA, 9988.HK) shares surge on China's pledge to enact "more proactive" fiscal stimulus. Hershey (HSY) jumps by over 12% upon news that Mondelez International (MDLZ) is exploring a takeover of the chocolate company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Mondelēz is reportedly exploring Hershey takeover
summary: Mondelēz (MDLZ) is reportedly exploring a takeover of Hershey (HSY), according to a Bloomberg report. Following the news, Hershey stock has surged while Mondelez stock is under pressure. Catalysts Co-Hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills take a closer look. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Consumer Staples ETF Turns Positive After Hershey Takeover Report
summary: An ETF tracking consumer goods stocks reversed course after a report broke that Mondelez International is eyeing a potential takeover of Hershey.  The Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR ETF is now up 0.2% after being down as much as 0.4% shortly after the open.  The U-turn comes after a Bloomberg report, citing people familiar with the matter, said Cadbury maker Mondelez has made a “preliminary approach about a possible combination” with the chocolate maker.

headline: Cadbury-owner Mondelez exploring Hershey acquisition, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Shares of Hershey, which has a market capitalization of about $35 billion, rose as much as 19% to $208.03, while those of Mondelez were down about 4% in morning trading.  Mondelez, which is valued at around $84 billion, has made a preliminary approach about a possible combination, Bloomberg reported, adding that deliberations were in the early stages and there was no certainty that discussions would lead to a deal.  Both Mondelez and Hershey declined to comment.
